overall_evaluation.brief_comment: 作文基本切题，情节连贯，但存在较多语法错误和表达不准确之处，语言表达较为简单，部分句子结构混乱，影响整体流畅性。

content.evidence: 通过描述David的失望眼神和作者内心的挫败感，展现了人物心理变化。
从劝说David参赛到最终出发，逻辑清晰，符合事件发展顺序。

language.evidence: 如'clapped his hands', 'filled with disappointment', 'clench his fists'等，增强了画面感。
如'I make an determination...I will help the pitiful child.'虽有语法问题，但体现了学生对表达意图的追求。

structure.description: 两段之间通过时间推进和动作转换实现自然过渡，保持了叙事的连贯性。

content.description: 可以增加对环境、其他人物反应或内心独白的描写，使故事更具感染力。

language.evidence: 如'encourage'应为'encouraged', 'make an determination'应为'made a determination', 'hapeness'应为'happiness'等。
如'pitiful child'略显贬义，可用'brave boy'或'determined runner'替代；'very hard'应为'very hard-working'。

structure.description: 最后一句未完成，缺乏收尾，建议补充比赛结果或情感升华。

structure: 缺少连接词导致语义断裂

detailed_errors.original_sentence: David clapped his hands and encourage other children.
detailed_errors.correction: David clapped his hands and encouraged other children.
detailed_errors.explanation: and连接两个并列谓语，前后时态需一致，'clapped'是过去式，'encourage'应改为'encouraged'。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: David clapped his hands and cheered for the other children.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I looked at him who was smile but his eyes were filled with disappointment.
detailed_errors.correction: I looked at him, who was smiling, but his eyes were filled with disappointment.
detailed_errors.explanation: 'who was smile'语法错误，应为'was smiling'；逗号缺失导致句子结构混乱。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I looked at him—his lips curved into a smile, yet his eyes betrayed a deep sense of disappointment.

detailed_errors.explanation: make应为过去式made；'an'用于元音前，'determination'以辅音开头，应使用'a'。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I made up my mind to support him.

detailed_errors.explanation: hard是副词，不能直接修饰人；应使用形容词'hard-working'表示‘努力的’。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: you are incredibly determined and strong-willed

detailed_errors.original_sentence: his eyes were filled with hapeness
detailed_errors.correction: his eyes were filled with happiness
detailed_errors.explanation: hapeness是错误拼写，正确形式为'happiness'。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: his eyes sparkled with joy and hope

detailed_errors.original_sentence: David and I come back to the starting
detailed_errors.correction: David and I came back to the starting line
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: David and I walked back together to the starting line.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I gave David a hug with tightly
detailed_errors.correction: I gave David a tight hug
detailed_errors.explanation: with tightly语法错误，'tightly'是副词，不能作宾语补足语；应使用形容词'tight'修饰'hug'。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I pulled him into a firm embrace, offering silent encouragement.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: David has a deep breath and clench his fists
detailed_errors.correction: David took a deep breath and clenched his fists
detailed_errors.explanation: has应为took，clench应为clenched，保持时态一致。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: David drew in a deep breath, his fists tightening with resolve.

revised_text:
We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn't look at me. He clapped his hands and cheered for the other children. I looked at him—his lips curved into a smile, yet his eyes betrayed a deep sense of disappointment. A wave of frustration washed over me, followed by a surge of determination. I made up my mind: I would help this brave boy. I said, 'David, you are incredibly hard-working, and I believe you can finish this race. I wish you could believe in yourself.' David nodded slowly, and his eyes sparkled with joy and hope. Together, we walked back to the starting line. I pulled him into a firm embrace, offering silent encouragement.

I watched as David moved up to the starting line with the other runners. He took a deep breath, his fists tightening with resolve. I could feel the strength of his determination in every breath he took. As the starting signal sounded, all the runners surged forward, and David began his journey—not just across the forest path, but toward a new belief in himself.
